last.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: most recent or nearest to the present time
last.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I hadn’t seen him since the last meeting.
Interest in golf has grown rapidly in the last ten years.
Things have changed since the last time (=the most recent occasion) you were here.
Did you see the game on TV last night?
The law was passed last August.
last.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: happening or existing at the end, with no others after
last.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: I didn’t read the last chapter of the book.
The next meeting will be held in the last week in June.
Anna was the last person to see him alive.
the last person/thing etc to do something
on the last but one day of his trial
last.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: remaining after all others have gone, been used etc
last.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Can I have the last piece of cake?
All the money was gone; every last penny of it.
last.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: the one before this one
last
most recent or nearest to the present time
His last film was much better.
It rained all day last Saturday.
The last time I saw her was two years ago.
previous
before this one, or before the one that you are talking about
See the diagram in the previous chapter.
His previous records had all been jazz records.
How much were you earning in your previous job?
existing or having a particular position in the past, but not now
the former Soviet Union
the former US president
Interest rates are unlikely to return to their former level.
the former Chief Executive
old
used about a person or thing that existed in the past, but has been replaced by a newer one
an old boyfriend
The old model was much slower.
the one that comes at the end
last
happening or existing at the end, with no others after
What time does the last train leave?
Our house is the last one on the right.
final
last in a series of actions, events, parts of a story etc
It’s the final game of the championship tomorrow.
the final scene of the film
closing
used about the last part of a long period of time, or of an event, book etc that has been exciting or interesting
the closing years of the twentieth century
Barnes scored the winning goal in the closing minutes of the game.
concluding
used about the last part of a piece of writing, a speech, or an organized event, that ends it in a definite way
the concluding section of the report
the judge’s concluding remarks
penultimate
the one before the last one
the penultimate chapter
last.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: When I last saw her, she was working in New York.
last.translation[1].definitions[0].note_: Last is used with the simple past
I have last seen her in 2008
Last usually comes before a main verb
I last went to London in June
Last comes after ‘be’ when it is the main verb
I was last in London in June
Last comes after the first auxiliary
When did you last hear from Tara?
last.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Last of all, I’d like to thank everyone for coming.
last.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to continue for a particular length of time
last.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The hot weather lasted for the whole month of June.
last.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to continue to exist, be effective, or remain in good condition for a long time
last.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: A good coat will last you ten years.
Cut flowers will last longer if you put flower food in the water.
last.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: to manage to remain in the same situation, even when this is difficult
last.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: They won’t be able to last much longer without fresh supplies.
If you go into the job with that attitude, you won’t last long.
She feared she might not be able to last out the afternoon in court without fainting.
last.translation[3].definitions[3].defin: to be enough for someone for a period of time
last.translation[3].definitions[3].examp: The batteries should last for 20 hours playing time.
We only had $50 to last us the rest of the month.
last.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: a piece of wood or metal shaped like a human foot, used by someone who makes and repairs shoes
